summary: This is an email chain from December 2020 regarding a document request from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The request seeks a final copy of the Bureau of Prisons' 'Psychological Reconstruction of Inmate Jeffrey Epstein' and the MCC's response, for discovery purposes in the capital trial of an inmate named Tartaglione.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the Bureau of Prisons' 'Psychological Reconstruction' report that is being requested.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: An inmate whose capital trial is the reason for the document request regarding Jeffrey Epstein's psychological report.

connections.description: Epstein's psychological report is being sought for discovery in Tartaglione's capital trial, creating a legal/documentary link between the two inmates.

events.title: Initial document request email
events.description: A Deputy Chief from the U.S. Attorney's Office emails 'M' to request the BOP's Psychological Reconstruction of Jeffrey Epstein and the MCC's response for Tartaglione's trial.

events.title: Follow-up on document request
events.description: A follow-up email is sent regarding the initial request for Jeffrey Epstein's psychological report.

locations: 300 Quarropas Street, White Plains, New York 10601
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was seeking a 'Psychological Reconstruction of Inmate Jeffrey Epstein' prepared by the Bureau of Prisons (BOP).
The document was requested for discovery obligations related to the capital phase of the trial of an inmate named Tartaglione.
The request also sought the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC)'s response to the psychological report.
The correspondence indicates official interest in Epstein's psychological state while in BOP custody, for use in another federal case.
